channel.title: I Can't Get My BufferedReader To Works Properly Inside A Public String

item.title: I Can't Get My BufferedReader To Works Properly Inside A Public String
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

Hi,

I Wrote A Script That Checks A Person’s Clan File, Then Returns The Read Text:

[code]Public String checkclan(){
try{
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader (new FileReader("./clans/"+playerName+".txt"));

    String info = "";
int startLine = 1;
int endLine = 1;
for (int i = 0; i < startLine; i++) { info = in.readLine(); }
for (int i = startLine; i < endLine + 1; i++) {
    info = in.readLine();

}

in.close();

return info;
}catch(Exception e) { sendMessage(“Lolz, Failed”); }
}[/code]

And When I Compile It, It Tells Me It Can’t Find the Return. I Tried Putting the Return Under the Catch, and It Tells Me That It Can’t Find The “Info” Variable. Finally, I Tried Stating “Info” as a Public Variable , But Then the reader Never Changes the Return, and It Stays as a Null.

Any help?

Thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: I Can't Get My BufferedReader To Works Properly Inside A Public String
